definition: this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)

sentences.english: It seems a bit idealist for me to think of money and private properties.
sentences.chinese: 我如此這般看待金錢和私有財產，似乎有些理想主義。

sentences.english: So much so that we resent anyone who dampens our excitement.
sentences.chinese: 如此這般以至於我們不滿任何挫傷我們興奮之情的人。

sentences.english: Having thus mastered addition, they move on to subtraction.
sentences.chinese: 如此這般地掌握了加法之後，他們又轉向減法。

sentences.english: Medical emergency-room dramas will never be the same again.
sentences.chinese: 如此這般，急診室的劇幕必將不復從前。

sentences.english: If these and such-like you can bear.
sentences.chinese: 倘若如此這般你能容忍。

sentences.english: That platinum is such a trickster.
sentences.chinese: 那個鉑原子核就是如此這般的一個騙子。

sentences.english: Then the next step will be revealed, then the next and so on.
sentences.chinese: 而後就是找到下一步，再下一步，如此這般。

sentences.english: There have been other Mays in other years, but never has there been so much blossom..
sentences.chinese: 沒有一個五月如此這般地繁花盛開。

sentences.english: This is so that you don’t squander your efforts or concentration.
sentences.chinese: 如此這般你就不會浪費你的努力或專心了。

definition: when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
less capable than desirable (idiom); not as strong as one would wish/the spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
ordinary and mediocre (idiom); nothing to write home about
separated in life and death/to part for ever
